brief_summary.textblock:
That exercise will reduce anemia and fatigue, while improving aerobic capacity, strength and
      hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell mitochondrial function.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Exercise on Anemia in MDS Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:Have a confirmed diagnosis of MDS, Have approval of the study medical
        monitor, be able to read English, be 21 years of age or older, give informed consent -

        Exclusion Criteria: Have physical limitations, be identified in the active or maintenance
        stage of exercise behavior

        -

facility.name: James P. Wilmot Cancer Center, University of Rochester

clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Exercise on Anemia in MDS Patients

primary_outcome.description: Aim to provide preliminary feasibility data on the effect of a stationary cycling program on anemia and acrocytosis, fatigue, aerobic capacity, strength, and hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell mitochondrial function in MDS patients.
primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility data on the effect of a stationary cycling program

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
clinical_study.why_stopped: We were unable to find patients that fit the eligibility criteria.
